commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Let me start with μ's second-year students. Honoka, Umi, Kotori, can you introduce yourselves again?

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Okay!

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: I'm Honoka Kosaka, a second-year student at Otonokizaka High. The first time I saw a school idol, I wanted to be one, too. I love school idols!

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: I'm Umi Sonoda, also a second-year student at Otonokizaka High. Honoka said she was going to be a school idol, so I ended up one, too.

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: You "ended up" one, too? You didn't want to?

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: *Giggle* I only thought that at first. Now I have just as much passion for it as Honoka.

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: We love Honoka, so we want to do what she wants to, right?

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: Kotori! Well, I guess I can't deny that.

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: *Chuckle* I'm Kotori Minami, a second-year student at Otonokizaka High. Honoka and Umi have been my close friends since we were little, so I decided to join, too.

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Umi writes the lyrics to our songs and Kotori makes our costumes.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: So you were friends before becoming idols. It must be fun doing this with friends!

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: It is! Every day is super fun. It's the best.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: *Giggle* That's just like you, Honoka. Um, after the introductions...

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Hey, what about you?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: M-Me?!

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Yeah! You're interested in school idols, right?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Of course! I'm actually doing--

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: What?! You're a school idol, too?!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: N-Not exactly! I help the idols at a school called Nijigasaki High.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I write lyrics and music and try to support everyone.

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: I see! So that makes us the same, huh?

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: Writing lyrics and music? That's amazing! I bet you'd have a lot to talk about with Maki and Umi.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: The same? I don't think I'm anywhere near the level of μ's.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (But someday...)

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I want to do my best and catch up to you guys!

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Catch up to us? You're already have! You're involved with school idols, aren't you?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Um, yeah but...

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: I know you're here to interview us, but I feel like we're both on the same path.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Honoka...

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (I only came here for an interview, but Honoka is kind and is reaching out to me. I'm so happy.)

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: I'm glad it's you that came. I bet we can be great friends.

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: However, we need to do a proper interview.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Right!

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: We're actually meeting with someone about our next performance today, so it seems you came at a good time for an interview.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Really? I'm pretty lucky, aren't I?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (I wonder what a group so far ahead of us like μ's does to get ready for a concert.)

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: We won't be talking about the new song until Maki gets here, so what should we talk about until then?

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: Honoka. Is there anything you'd like to try?

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Umm... Hmm... Oh! Umi, make the lyrics totally awesome, okay!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Totally awesome... (That's a pretty broad request.)

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: Totally awesome doesn't tell me anything! I've told you a million times, you need to be more specific.

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: But whenever I tell you to write totally awesome lyrics, that's exactly what you do!

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: *Giggle* I bet that's because Umi thinks so hard about her lyrics.

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: Kotori is right. I don't write good lyrics just because you tell me to write something "totally awesome!"

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Whaaat?! I didn't know that.

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: It takes a while to think up lyrics. Just how it is. Honoka, have you done anything fun lately?

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Fun... Oh! Yesterday when I ate ramen with Rin, instead of getting extra noodles when she was done, she got a whole different ramen.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Uh, hm?! (Ramen? Extra noodles?)

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Sorry, I'm not sure what you're talking about. Could you explain again?

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: She didn't order more noodles after eating, but ordered a whole other ramen! It was so fun for some reason.

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: Honoka. I don't think many other people would understand why that's fun.

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Oh... Sorry.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (Does she get ideas from lyrics from a second helping of ramen?)

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: Come to think of it, I found a new bakery recently. It doubled as a café. It was so fancy!

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: That sounds great! We should stop by on our way home today.

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: I'm sorry. I said we were going to talk about our next performance, but they ended up talking about other things.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: That's okay. I just thought you were going to decide on a theme beforehand.

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: Oh, thank you for taking this seriously! There aren't many as serious as you in μ's.

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: Choosing a theme and talking things over is important, but...

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: But what?

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: I think it's more important to face what you like first.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: What you like?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (I had fun talking with them after that. The way they planned their performance was different from what I expected.)

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (How do they make their shows the way they do? I'm so curious!)
